column4: well, gentoo doesn't really come with anything 'out of the box'
gentoo comes with whatever you want gentoo to come with

don't play it , but google does help :-p

ah.  point taken

it works for ext3 too...i use it myself :)
good to know :p
i've found there is samba client support in ubuntu.
any idea how it can be enabled? smb client for nautilus?
within dapper, it's on by default places->network servers
i know how to use it in dapper..but what i want to know if i can kind of enable it or something in gentoo..
ahh.  yeah.  i used gentoo for a good couple'a years and never really figured every thing out.  If i had to guess, it would be adding the +samba useflag when building nautilus/gnome
ok..any idea where the official nautilus channel is? doesnt seem to be on freenode..?
no idea, but #gentoo is always busy
np ;)
